list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: It is very unpleasant to have to inhale the smoke from other people’s cigarettes.

list_ex_of_english: I am not accepting the dictum of the scientists that inhaling such a large quantity of dust does not eventually disable a man.
We all feel that they must be inhaling something which will affect their lungs.
The handlers will be inhaling considerable amounts if they are dipping between 500 and 1,000 sheep.
Intentional misuse by deliberately concentrating and inhaling the contents can cause death.
One microscopic fragment inhaled by an unfortunate employee can lead to death.
A tremendous amount of slate dust was inhaled by ordinary quarry workers in my early days.
If asbestos dust is inhaled the person inhaling contracts a serious and usually deadly disease.
Small particles of saliva and aerosol contaminated by streptococci, which are inhaled into the respiratory tract, expose the nasal and bronchial mucosa more easily to the pathogen.
